snippet: Lawmakers are searching for a possible way to censure the governor, who said he was seeking “spiritual guidance,” and pledged never to speak to reporters again....
abstract: Maine Gov Paul R LePage declares he will not step down despite protests over his recent remarks on drugs and race; tells critics his behavior stems from having backbone and is not due, as some have speculated, to substance abuse or mental issues.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers are searching for a possible way to censure the governor, who said he was seeking “spiritual guidance,” and pledged never to speak to reporters again.

headline.main: Paul LePage, the Governor of Maine, Now Says He’s Not Quitting
headline.print_headline: In Maine, a Defiant Governor Says He Has ‘Backbone’ and Won’t Quit
